title: Information for VUMC Employees and Patients
cleaned_text: Being current with COVID vaccinations and boosters is the best way to reduce risk of serious illness and protect those with underlying health conditions. Schedule your COVID vaccines and boosters [Learn more here](https://www.vanderbilthealth.com/information/covid-vaccines)about scheduling your COVID-19 vaccine from Vanderbilt Health. - Or find a vaccine or booster close to home at [Vaccines.gov](https://www.vaccines.gov/). [See latest on vaccination from the CDC](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html). Current visitor policies Masking is optional in our hospitals and clinics for employees, patients and visitors. Please respect others' choices. In some circumstances, such as a patient who has symptoms of acute respiratory infection, some patients may be asked to mask. This is how we did things before the COVID pandemic. - Visitor policies [for all hospitals](https://www.vanderbilthealth.com/information/current-visitor-policies-vanderbilt-hospitals-and-clinics)except Monroe Carell Jr. Children's Hospital. - Visitor policies [for Monroe Carell](https://www.childrenshospitalvanderbilt.org/information/current-visitor-policies-monroe-carell). Post-COVID care Sometimes, people have lingering symptoms after a case of COVID. [Learn more about post-COVID care at Vanderbilt Health](https://www.vanderbilthealth.com/service/adult-post-covid-clinic). COVID testing before a procedure - COVID testing is required before some surgeries and procedures at Vanderbilt Health. [Learn more here](https://www.vanderbilthealth.com/test/covid-19-testing). [Prepare for your child's procedure at Monroe Carell](https://www.childrenshospitalvanderbilt.org/test/covid-19-testing). Other Ways to Reduce Spread of Respiratory Infection Here are some common-sense tips for reducing the spread of respiratory infections, including COVID, flu, RSV and common colds. - Wash hands well and often. - Keep distance from others in public settings. - Cover coughs and sneezes with handkerchiefs or your inner arm/sleeve. - Stay home if you feel sick, especially if you have a fever. If you must go out, wear a mask to protect others.
